intro: Lacinaria pycnostachya, commonly known as the dense-stalked lacinaria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
